CHAPTER 154: ZONING
Section
General Provisions
GENERAL PROVISIONS
§ 154.01 ENACTMENT; PREAMBLE.
(A) A chapter establishing zoning regulations for a portion of the county, a county of the state, providing for the
administration, enforcement, and amendment thereof, in accordance with the provisions of G.S. Ch. 153A, Pt. 3.
(B) Therefore, be it and the same is hereby enacted by the County Commissioners.
(Ord. passed 3-14-1994)
§ 154.02 SHORT TITLE.
These regulations shall be known as the "Zoning Ordinance for the County of Beaufort, North Carolina".
(Ord. passed 3-14-1994)
§ 154.03 JURISDICTION.
These regulations shall govern the use and development thereon of all lands described as a Planned Unit Development
District (PUD) which is hereinafter made a part of these regulations to the same extent as if the information set forth on said
PUD was fully described and incorporated herein. These regulations shall further govern other properties upon request by
the landowner made subject hereto by action of the County Commissioners.
(Ord. passed 3-14-1994)
§ 154.04 PURPOSE.
The purpose of this chapter is to promote the health, safety, morals, and the general welfare of the county, and to evaluate
the administrative burdens and the property owner benefits relating to the enactment and enforcement of a zoning
ordinance. This chapter has been developed with reasonable consideration to the character of the district and its uses and
in accordance with the comprehensive land use plan.
(Ord. passed 3-14-1994)

different meaning.

§ 154.06 TENSE AND NUMBER.
(A) The present tense includes the future tense, and the future tense includes the present tense.
(B) The singular number includes the plural number, and the plural number includes the singular number.
(C) The word "and" may be read as "or" and "or" may be read as "and" where sense requires it.
(D) Any citation of a statute, law, or ordinance contained in this chapter shall be deemed to refer to such statute, law, or
ordinance as amended, whether or not such designation is included in the citation.
(Ord. passed 3-14-1994)
§ 154.07 ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICER.
The primary responsibility for administering and enforcing this chapter is assigned to the County Planner. The County
Planner may be provided with assistance of such persons as directed by the County Manager. Appeal from decisions of the
County Planner shall be made to the Board of County Commissioners.
(Ord. passed 3-14-1994)
§ 154.08 EFFECTIVE DATE.
This chapter shall take effect and be enforced from and after its passage and adoption.
(Ord. passed 3-14-1994)
PLANNED UNIT DEVELOPMENT DISTRICT
§ 154.20 PURPOSE.
The purpose of this district is to encourage comprehensive planning for sizable tracts of land under single ownership or
control so as to promote the construction and use of appropriate commercial, retail, and recreational service areas for the
benefit of residential development within the planned unit development and, where appropriate, additional utilization by other
residents of and visitors to the county.
(Ord. passed 3-14-1994)
§ 154.21 PERMITTED USES.
(A) Single-family dwellings, with the exception of mobile homes;
(B) Multi-family dwellings;
(C) Accessory buildings or uses;
(D) Office and professional facilities;
(E) Retail commercial facilities;
(F) Recreational uses, including golf courses, parks, and marinas; and
(G) Utility structures and facilities.
(Ord. passed 3-14-1994)

§ 154.22 MINIMUM ACREAGE.
No property shall be assigned a PUD zoning designation unless such property (including any previously zoned adjacent
property under common control or ownership with the property so designated) includes 20 or more contiguous acres. As
used herein, contiguous shall include properties on opposite sides of a street right-of-way or watercourse.
(Ord. passed 3-14-1994)
§ 154.23 PUD ACREAGE.
In any PUD, a minimum of 75% of the total acreage within the PUD shall be utilized for either residential or recreational
purposes, including rights-of-way adjacent to recreational or residential uses.
(Ord. passed 3-14-1994)
§ 154.24 DENSITY OF DEVELOPMENT.
There shall be no more than two and one-half living units, average, for each acre of the property designated PUD and
utilized for residential or recreational purposes. Within all areas within the PUD designated for utilization for retail or office
purposes, there shall be no more than 50% impervious surface coverage (as defined by the Department of Environmental
Management of the state in implementation of the state coastal stormwater regulations), on average, for all acreage to be so
utilized.
(Ord. passed 3-14-1994)
§ 154.25 APPROVAL.
(A) The owner of any property seeking to have such property zoned PUD shall submit, at or prior to the time of
submission of a sketch plan under Chapter 153 of this code of ordinances, a master site and development plan for all
property zoned (or requested to be zoned) PUD. Ten copies of such site development plan shall be submitted to the county.
The site development plan must show, at a minimum, the following:
(1) All proposed public or private street rights-of-way;
(2) The proposed location of all single-family residential development;
(3) The proposed location of all multi-family development;
(4) The proposed location of all recreational amenities:
(5) The proposed location of all office and professional facilities;
(6) The proposed location of all commercial facilities;
(7) The proposed location of all utility facilities; and
(8) The proposed density of development for each site designated single-family residential, for each site designated
multi-family residential, for each site designated for office and professional utilization, and for each site designated for
commercial utilization. Furthermore, the development plan shall include the gross acreage for the project, the gross
residential density (including recreational and open spaces), and the impervious surface limitations for each office,
professional, and commercial site.
(B) The Commissioners may designate property PUD if the Commissioners determine that the proposed development
plan is in the best interest of the county because the plan meets the requirements of this chapter and represents a
comprehensive and coordinated approach to land planning and use on the property so designated. Adoption of a PUD
zoning classification for a developmental site shall authorize the processing of all subdivision plans within the designated
tract in accordance with the PUD provisions of the county subdivision and this chapter.
(Ord. passed 3-14-1994)
§ 154.26 CHANGE IN PLANS.
The owner of each tract designated PUD shall be allowed to submit plats for subdivision approval that are inconsistent
with particular site designations as shown on the master plan; however, if any such changes are deemed material by the
Administrator as defined in § 153.04, the applicant may be requested to provide to the county an updated master
development plan for the entire property, which updated plan must conform with all limitations contained within this chapter.
(Ord. passed 3-14-1994)
